text:
Hello. How can use `if`-condition with multiple conditions? This does not seem to have any effect
```{% if item != 'abc' or item != 'def' %}```

That statement is always `true`.
3 cases:
• `item == 'abc'` : `false or true` = `true`
• `item == 'def'` : `true or false` = `true`
• `item == 'other'`: `true or true` = `true`

Hi,

I'm using the crm_object hubl tag to pull in some data about deals to a CMS page. I've noticed that the deal 'createdate' property now returns in the format 'd/m/y' (my portal is in UK date format) when it used to return a timestamp?

Just wondering if anybody else has noticed this?

Thanks for your help!
David
